title: How to write a professional letter of recommendation - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, the creation of a professional letter of recommendation is not as easy as pie. What you have to start with is brainstorming. You first need to figure out what educational institution or company the person that you recommend wishes to get accepted to. Later, you will have to compose a list of their strengths and represent yourself as a credible source of information. Start with a thoroughly written plan, proceed with a draft, have the applicant review it, and then polish your LoR. Regardless of whether you need to write this document on your own or with the help of a highly qualified specialist, understanding of the general rules, specifics, and tricks of the trade is essential.  Writing an LoR on your own vs. ordering a professional recommendation letter: which one is better? It depends on several factors. In case you have decent experience in this sphere, tons of similar documents written in the past, most of which were successful, and a huge amount of time, writing a letter of recommendation solo would be better. However, you would not be reading this post if you were an expert, right? Alternatively, getting professional recommendation letter assistance should be your priority. It would help if you examined a skillfully written LoR at least once to learn how it is all done. What are some valuable tips for writing an outstanding letter of recommendation? Let’s begin with what to include in a recommendation letter: ● Intro. Let the reader discover the most necessary information about you. ● Type of cooperation you had with the applicant. ● Evaluation of the applicant’s performance, evidenced by available skills. ● Your guarantees about the applicant. ● Contact details. Now, let’s get down to tips for writing a letter of recommendation: ● Meet in person, do an interview. ● Let your modesty vanish, be confident in your words. ● Provide intriguing information about the applicant’s background and skills. ● Illustrate the versatility of the person that you recommend. ● Focus on the company’s or university’s goals and requirements. Having doubts about how to create a letter of recommendation? Follow the guidelines mentioned above to prepare a superior LoR.
